title: Educational requirements for licensure effective December 31, 2000
context: ยง466-5.5 Educational requirements for licensure effective December 31, 2000. Effective December 31, 2000, an applicant for licensure shall have at least one-hundred-fifty semester hours of college education. Within the one-hundred-fifty semester hours, the applicant shall have: (1) A baccalaureate or higher degree conferred by a college or university acceptable to the board; and (2) An accounting concentration or its equivalent as specified in the rules of the board; except that applicants for licensure who have successfully completed the Uniform Certified Public Accountant Examination before December 31, 2000, or held conditional credit before December 31, 2000, and subsequently completed the examination before the conditional credit expired, may continue to meet the educational requirements of section 466-5(b). [L 1997, c 35, ยง1; am L 2002, c 135, ยง1] Revision Note Subsection designation deleted pursuant to ยง23G-15(1).
